subject: TRUE FAITH = ASSURANCE
verse: What is faith? It is the confident assurance that what  we hope for is going to happen. It is the evidence of things we cannot yet see. (Hebrews 11:1)
reflection:
Do you remember how you felt when you were very young and your birthday approached? You were ex cited and anxious.You knew you would certainly receive gifts and other special treats.
But somethings would be a surprise. Birthdays combine assurance and anticipation and so does faith! Faith is the conviction based on past experiences that God’s new and fresh surprises will surely be ours.
prayer: Loving God, fill us with the childlike excitement and trust that comes from knowing Your goodness, and help us anticipate with joy the fresh surprises You have in store for us each day. May our faith grow ever stronger as we remember Your faithfulness and look forward to Your continued blessings in our lives. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*What is faith? It is the confident assurance that what *

*we **hope for is going to happen. It is the evidence of things **we cannot
yet see. *(Heb. 11:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Do you remember how you felt when you were very young and your birthday
approached? You were ex-

cited and anxious.You knew you would certainly receive gifts and other
special treats. But somethings would be a surprise. Birthdays combine assurance
and anticipation and so does faith! *Faith is the con**viction *

*based on past experiences that God’s new and fresh*

*surprises will surely be ours. *

* Pastor Sather*

subject: NOT GOD'S FAULT
verse: Let no one say when he is tempted, “I am tempted  by God,”f or God cannot be tempted by evil, nor  does He Himself tempt anyone. Temptation come  from the lure of our own evil desires. (James 1:13, 14)
reflection:
People who live for God often wonder why they still have temptations.
Does God still tempt them? God tests people, but He does not tempt them by trying to seduce them to sin.
God allows Satan to tempt people, however, in order to refine their faith. And to help them grow in their dependence on Christ. We can resist the temptation to sin by turning to God for strength and choosing to obey His Word.
prayer: Holy God, grant us the strength to resist temptation and the wisdom to turn to You in times of trial. Help us grow in our faith and dependence on Christ as we face life's challenges, always choosing to obey Your Word. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*Let no one say when he is tempted, “I am tempted *

*by God,”**f or God cannot be tempted by evil, nor *

*does He Himself **tempt anyone. Temptation come *

*from the lure of our **own evil desires. *(Jm. 1:13, 14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

People who live for God often wonder why they still have temptations. Does
God still tempt them? God

tests people, but He does not tempt them by trying to seduce them to sin.
God allows Satan to tempt people, however, in order to refine their faith.
And to help

them grow in their dependence on Christ. *We can *

*resist the temptation to sin by** turning* t*o God for strength and
choosing to obey His** Word.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: CAN YOU WAIT
verse: Wait patiently for the Lord. Be brave and  courageous.  Yes, wait patiently for the Lord.  (Psalm 27:14)
reflection:
David knew from experience what it meant to wait for the Lord. He had been anointed king at age 16 but didn’t become king until he was 30. During the interim, he was chased through the wilderness by jealous king Saul.
David had to wait on God for the fulfillment of his promise to reign. Later, after becoming king, He was chased by his rebellious son, Absalom. Waiting for God is not easy Often it seems that He isn’t answering our prayers or doesn’t understand the urgency of our situation. That kind of thinking implies that God is not in control or is not fair. But God IS worth waiting for (Lamentations 3:24-26 calls us to hope in and wait for the Lord because often God uses times of waiting to refresh, renew, and teach us. Make good use of your waiting times by discov ering what God may be trying to teach you in them.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to trust in Your perfect timing and to use periods of waiting as opportunities for growth and renewal. Teach us patience and perseverance as we seek Your will, knowing that You are always working for our good. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

* Wait patiently for the Lord. Be brave and *

*courageous.** Yes, wait patiently for the Lord. *

(Ps. 27:14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

David knew from experience what it meant to

wait for the Lord. He had been anointed king at

age 16 but didn’t become king until he was 30.

During the interim, he was chased through the wilderness by jealous king
Saul. David had to

wait on God for the fulfilment of his promise to

reign. Later, after becoming king, He was chased

by his rebellious son, Absalom. Waiting for God

is not easy Often it seems that He isn’t answering

our prayers or doesn’t understand the urgency of

our situation. That kind of thinking implies that

God is not in control or is not fair. But God *IS *

worth waiting for (Lam. 3:24-26 calls us to hope

in and wait for the Lord because often God uses

times of waiting to refresh, renew, and teach us.

*Make good use of your waiting times **by* *discov-*

*ering **what God may be trying to teach you in*

* them.*

* Pastor Sather*.

subject: A TIME TO PRAY A TIME TO ACT
verse: The Lord said to Moses, “Why are you crying out to Me! Use your shepherd’s staff—hold it over the water, and a path will open before you through the sea. Then all the people of Israel will pass through on dry ground. (Exodus 14:15)
reflection:
The Lord told Moses to stop praying and get moving!
Prayer must have a vital place in our lives, but there
is also a place for action. Sometimes we know what
to do but we pray for more guidance as an excuse to
postpone doing it. If we know what we should do, then it's time to get moving,
prayer: Almighty God, grant us the courage to act decisively when we know Your will, and help us discern when it's time to move forward in faith rather than lingering in prayer. Guide our steps as we seek to balance contemplation with action in our daily walk with You. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 176cfa625394d7a7
subject   : Subject: A TIME TO PRAY A TIME TO ACT (1-5-21)

date      : Mon, 4 Jan 2021 17:05:41 -0600

*Today’s Verses:*

*The Lord said to Moses, “Why are you crying out to Me! **Use your
shepherd’s staff—hold it over the water, and a **path will open before you
through the sea. Then all the **people of Israel will pass through on dry
ground.*



*Today’s Reflection:*

The Lord told Moses to stop praying and get moving!

Prayer must have a vital place in our lives, but there

is also a place for action. Sometimes we know what

to do but we pray for more guidance as an excuse to

postpone doing it. *If we know what we should do,*

*then it's time to get moving, *

* Pastor Sather*

subject: NEVER ALONE
verse: I hereby command you, be strong and courageous;  do not be frightened or dismayed, for the Lord your God is with you wherever you go. (Joshua 1:9)
reflection:
Since Covig took over our country-and the chall enges about the election being a farse the country has been in turmoil, and we even hear that our democracy is being threatened. Let us put to
memory . . . “The Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.” Only He can give us the courage to face life and death. May we be moved to call up on His power and promises daily.
prayer: Faithful God, grant us the courage to face the challenges and uncertainties in our nation, remembering Your promise to be with us always. Help us to rely on Your power and promises daily, finding strength and hope in Your unfailing presence. (AI)

subject: TRUE PRAISE SHOULD COME FROM THE HEART
verse: Praise His name with dancing, accompanied by tambourine and harp. The Lord delights in His  people; He crowns the humble with salvation.  Let the faithful rejoice in this honor. Let them  sing for joy as they lie on their beds. (Psalm 149:3-5)
reflection: Even through the Bible invites us to praise God, we often are not sure how to go about it. Here several ways are suggested: singing, dancing, or playing musical instruments. God enjoys His people, AND We should enjoy praising Him.
prayer: Holy God, inspire us to praise You with joyful hearts through song, dance, and music, and help us to delight in worshiping You as much as You delight in us. May our expressions of praise draw us closer to You and bring glory to Your name. (AI)

*people; He crowns the **humble with salvation. *

*Let the faithful rejoice in this honor. **Let them *

*sing for joy as they lie on their beds. *(Ps. 149:3-5)

we often are not sure how to go about it. Here

several ways are suggested: singing, dancing, or

playing musical instruments. God enjoys His

people, *AND We should* *enjoy praising Him.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: The author is unknown to the text I am about to share--
verse: His question is—Will God really live on earth?  Why, even the highest heavens cannot contain You.  How much less this temple that I have built.! Listen  to my prayer and my request, O Lord my God. Hear  the cry and prayer that Your servant is making to You today. (I Kings 8:27, 28
reflection: We should try our best to build a beautiful and help ful place of worship to be a testimony and credit to God. In so doing, however, we must remember that God cannot be contained in our buildings or beautiful settings. He is far greater than any building, so we must focus our praise on Him and not merely on the place of worship.
prayer: Eternal God, as we strive to create beautiful spaces for worship, remind us that Your presence extends far beyond any structure we could build, and help us to focus our hearts and minds on praising You above all else. (AI)

8:27, 28

God cannot be contained in our buildings or beautiful settings. *He is far

*the place of worship. *

subject: GOD SILENTLY AT WORK
verse: The Lord is watching everywhere, keeping His  eyes on both the evil and the good. (Proverbs 15:3)
reflection: At times it seems like God has let sin run rampant in the world, and we wonder if He really notices it. But God sees everything clearly-but the evil actions and the evil intentions lying beneath them (15:11). He is not an indifferent observer. He cares and is active in the world. Right now His work may be unseen and unfelt, but don’t give up. One day He will wipe out evil and punish the evil doers, just as He will establish the good and reward those who do His will.
prayer: Almighty God, we trust that You see all the evil in this world and are not indifferent to it. Help us to persevere in faith, knowing that You will ultimately establish justice and righteousness according to Your perfect will. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord is watching everywhere, keeping His *

*eyes on **both the evil and the good. *(Pro. 15:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

At times it seems like God has let sin run rampant

in the world, and we wonder if He really notices it.

*But *God sees *everything* clearly—but the evil act-

ions and the evil intentions lying beneath them

(15:11). He is not an indifferent observer. He cares

and is active in the world. *Right now*—His work

may be unseen and unfelt, *but* don’t give up. One

day He will wipe out evil and punish the evil

doers, just as He will establish the good and reward those who do His will.

*Pastor Sather*

subject: FROM TRIVIA TO TREASURE
verse: “While your servant was busy here and  there, the man disappeared.” (I Kings 20:40)
reflection:
According to the account in I Kings, a prophet told King Ahab a fictitious story. He said he had been guarding a prisoner, but he had been negligent “busy here and there” and the prisoner had escaped. The lesson was meant to get Ahab’s attention because he had let his enemy, King Ben-Hadad of Syria, escape. Many people leave the important tasks of life undone
because they are preoccupied with the trivial things of life, thus the big picture escapes them. Jesus Christ came into the world and into our hearts on the bridge of faith built by the Holy Spirit, through the Gospel, for the purpose of saving us from sin and death.The Redeemer took our attention away from the trifles of the world, from man’s gaudy lights which keep us from seeing God’s Sun, in our pursuit of selfish interests and from being “busy here and there.” Instead, He wants us to focus our attention on the treasures of His Word and the joy of serving Him in His Kingdom. Ask Jesus, your priceless Treasure, your truest Friend, to keep you always near Him.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to focus on the treasures of Your Word and the joy of serving in Your Kingdom, rather than being distracted by the trivial things of this world. Keep us always near to Jesus, our priceless Treasure and truest Friend. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 176eea8b29a325bf
subject   : Subject: FROM TRIVIA TO TREASURE (1-11-21)

to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 10 Jan 2021 17:36:42 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“While your servant was busy here and *

*there, **the man** disappeared.” *(I Kings 20:40)



*Today’s Reflection:*

According to the account in I Kings, a

prophet told King Ahab a fictitious story.

He said he had been guarding a prisoner,

but he had been negligent “busy here and there” and the prisoner had
escaped. The

lesson was meant to get Ahab’s attention because he had let his enemy,
King Ben-Hadad
of Syria, escape. Many people

leave the important tasks of life undone

because they are preoccupied with the

trivial things of life, thus the big picture escapes them. Jesus Christ
came into the

world and into our hearts on the bridge

of faith built by the Holy Spirit, through the Gospel, for the purpose of
saving us

from sin and death.The Redeemer took

our attention away from the trifles of the world, from man’s gaudy lights
which keep

us from seeing God’s Sun, in our pursuit of selfish interests and from
being “busy here and there.” Instead, He wants us to focus

our attention on the treasures of His Word

and the joy of serving Him in His Kingdom. *Ask Jesus, **your **priceless
Treasure, your truest Friend, to keep **you **always near Him.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: GOOD HEALTH FOR SOUL AND BODY
verse: A cheerful look brings joy to the heart, and good news gives health to the bones. (Proverbs 15:30)
reflection:
The best medicine is the Gospel of Jesus Christ. It is the good news that the Lamb of God has taken away our sin and has reconciled us to God. This says it all: “Since we have been justified through faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ” (Romans 5:1). We can feel it in our bones!
Let us give thanks to the Lord Jesus, the great Physician, for bringing joy into our life by taking away our sins.
prayer: Lord Jesus, we thank You for being the great Physician who has healed our souls and brought us peace with God through Your sacrifice. May we always feel the joy of Your forgiveness deep within our hearts and live in gratitude for the reconciliation You have accomplished. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 176f3da7d03cbcf7

date      : Mon, 11 Jan 2021 17:49:11 -0600

*Today’s Verse:*

*A cheerful look brings joy to the heart, and good news gives **health to
the bones. *(Pro. 15:30)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The best medicine is the Gospel of Jesus Christ.

It is the good news that the Lamb of God has

taken away our sin and has reconciled us to God.

This says it all: *“Since we have been** justified *

*through faith, we have peace with God through*

* our **Lord Jesus Christ” *(Ro. 5:1). We can feel

it in our bones!

*Let us give thanks to the Lord Jesus, the great Physician, **for bringing
joy into our life by taking away our sins.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: SYMBOL OF CHRIST'S AUTHORITY
verse: “I will place on His shoulder the key to the house  of David; what He opens no one can shut, and  what He shuts no one can open.” (Isaiah 22:22)
reflection:
You will find this verse quoted in Revelation 3:7 by John.
As the one who possesses all power in heaven and
on earth Jesus exercises His power to delegate autho rity by entrusting to His disciples the office of the
Keys:
the authority to retain the sins of the impenit ent and to remit the sins of those who repent and
believe in Jesus as Savior. This is the power the
church exercises through the public ministry: it is
the power to close and to open heaven. Let us thank the Lord Jesus, the head of the church for having given His followers the power to forgive. Let us also remem ber to pray for our Government Officials.
prayer: Holy God, we thank You for entrusting Your church with the power to forgive sins and share Your grace with the world. Guide our leaders, both in the church and in government, to use their authority wisely and in accordance with Your will. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 176f8deaf157766b
subject   : Subject: SYMBOL OF CHRIST'S AUTHORITY (1-13-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 12 Jan 2021 17:11:52 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“I will place on His shoulder the key to the house *

*of David; what He opens no one can shut, and *

*what He shuts no one can open.” *(Isa. 22:22)



*Today’s Reflection:*

You will find this verse quoted in Rev. 3:7 by John.

As the one who *possesses* all power in heaven and

on earth Jesus exercises His power to delegate autho-

rity by entrusting to His disciples the office of the

Keys: the authority to retain the sins of the impenit-

ent and to remit the sins of those who repent and

believe in Jesus as Savior. This is the power the

church exercises through the public ministry: it is

the power to close and to open heaven.

*Let us thank the Lord Jesus, the head of the *

*church for having given His followers the power*

* to forgive.*



*Let us also remem**ber to pray for our Government Officials.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: HOW TO OVERCOME SATAN
verse: He told them,“I saw Satan falling from heaven as a flash of lightening! And I have given you  all the power of the enemy, and you can walk  among  snakes and scorpions and crush them. Nothing will injure you. But don’t rejoice just  because evil spirits obey you; rejoice because  your names are registered as citizens of heaven.” (Luke 10:18-20)
reflection:
Jesus may have been looking ahead to his victory over Satan at the cross. John 12:31, 32, indicates
that Satan would be judged and driven out at the time of Jesus’ death. On the other hand, Jesus may have been warning His disciples against pride. Perhaps He was referring to Isaiah 14:12-17, which begins, “How you are fallen from heaven, O shin ning star, son of the morning!” Some interpreters identify this verse with Satan and explain that
Satan’s pride led to all evil we see on earth today.
To Jesus’ disciples, who were thrilled with their power over evil spirits (“snakes and scorpions”), He may have been giving this stern warning; “Yours is the kind of pride that led to Satan’s downfall. Be careful!” Pastor Saher Let us thank God for giving us the victory over Satan through Jesus Christ our Lord.
prayer: Almighty God, we thank You for the victory over evil that You have given us through Your Son Jesus Christ, and we humbly ask for Your guidance to remain vigilant against pride in our own lives. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 176fe294d8d51f26
subject   : Subject: HOW TO OVERCOME SATAN (1-14-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 13 Jan 2021 17:51:28 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*He told them,“I saw Satan falling from heaven*

* as **a flash of lightening! And I have given you *

*all the power of the enemy, and you can walk *

*among** snakes and scorpions and crush them. Nothing **will injure you.
But don’t rejoice just *

*because **evil spirits obey you; rejoice because *

*your **names are registered as citizens of heaven.”*

(Lk. 10:18-20)


*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus may have been looking ahead to his victory over Satan at the cross.
Jn. 12:31, 32, indicates

that Satan would be judged and driven out at the

time of Jesus’ death. On the other hand, Jesus may have been warning His
disciples against pride. Perhaps He was referring to Isa. 14:12-17, which
begins, “How you are fallen from heaven, O shin-

ning star, son of the morning!” Some interpreters identify this verse with
Satan and explain that

Satan’s pride led to all evil we see on earth today.

To Jesus’ disciples, who were thrilled with their power over evil spirits
(“snakes and scorpions”),

He may have been giving this stern warning;

*“Yours is the kind of* *pride that led to Satan’s downfall. Be careful!”*

* Pastor Saher*

*Let us thank God for giving us the victory over*

*Satan through Jesus Christ our Lord.*

subject: JESUS WOUNDED BUT A WINNER
verse:
I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your offspring and hers;
He will crush your head., and you will strike His heel.” (Genesis 3:15)
reflection:
Let us thank God for frustrating the Devil’s plan by faithfully keeping His promise to provide us with a Savior, who in the Gospel is called the woman’s Seed or Offspring. A great battle was to take place between Satan and the Son of God, and in this deadly duel Satan’s power would be crushed, but not without wounds suffered by Jesus. However, these were mere mortal wounds. After His human death, Jesus rose again to life and proclaimed His victory. Our Lord, “The Lion of the tribe of Judah” (Revelation 5:5),once and for all overcame him who like a roaring lion tried to devour Christians, large and small. Since no one is too small for Satan to pursue, no one is too insignificant for the Savior to seek and to save. Jesus Christ died for all.
Let us thank God that we can rest assured that Jesus loves us, for the Bible tells us so!
prayer: Faithful God, we thank you for fulfilling your promise of salvation through Jesus Christ, who crushed Satan's power and overcame death, assuring us of your unfailing love for all people, great and small. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17703149bde75472
subject   : Subject: JESUS WOUNDED BUT A WINNER (1-15-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 14 Jan 2021 16:46:58 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your offspring
and hers; He will crush your head., and you will strike His heel.” *(Gen.
3:15)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Let us thank God for frustrating the Devil’s plan

by faithfully keeping His promise to provide us

with a Savior, who in the Gospel is called the woman’s Seed or Offspring. A
great battle was

to take place between Satan and the Son of God,

and in this dead-ly duel Satan’s power would be crushed, but not without
wounds suffered by

Jesus. However, these were mere mortal wounds. After His human death, Jesus
rose again to life

and proclaimed His victory. Our Lord, “The Lion

of the tribe of Judah” (Rev. 5:5),once and for all overcame him who like a
roaring lion tried to

devour Christians, large and small. Since no one

is too small for Satan to pursue, no one is too insignificant for the
Savior to seek and to save.

Jesus Christ died for all.

*Let us thank God that we can rest assured *

*that Jesus** loves us, for the Bible tells us so!*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: THE HEAVENLY BRIDEGROOM AND BRIDE
verse: I saw the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, coming  down out of heaven from God, prepared  as a bride beautifully dressed for her husband. (Revelation 21:2)
reflection: Through-out Scripture we are made aware of Christ’s love, because of His love He died for the church. But that isn’t the end of the story. The heavenly Bridegroom will come again in glory. St. John had a highly symbolic vision of the forthcom ing reunion of Christ with His church. We are pictured as coming to meet Him “prepared as a bride beautifully dressed for her husband.” The dress is the righteousness of Christ in which we are clad through faith in the Savior. Once again we need to pray that the Holy Spirit may sustain in us the great expectation of Jesus' return in glory.
prayer: Lord Jesus, as we await Your glorious return, clothe us in Your righteousness and keep our hearts filled with joyful anticipation. May the Holy Spirit sustain our faith and prepare us to meet You, our heavenly Bridegroom, with hearts overflowing with love and gratitude. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 177084b2fb30064b
subject   : Subject: THE HEAVENLY BRIDEGROOM AND BRIDE (1-16-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 15 Jan 2021 17:04:41 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*I saw the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, coming *

*down out of heaven **from God, prepared *

*as **a bride beautifully dressed for her* *husband. *(Rev. 21:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Through-out Scripture we are made aware

of Christ’s love, because of His love He

died for the church. But that isn’t the end

of the story. The heavenly Bridegroom

will come again in glory. St. John had a

highly symbolic vision of the forthcom-

ing reunion of Christ with His church.

We are pictured as coming to meet Him *“prepared **as a bride beauti**fully
dressed *

*for her husband.” *The dress is the right-eousness of Christ in which we
are clad through faith in the Savior. *Once **again *

*we need to pray that the Holy Spirit*

*may sustain in us the great expectation *

*of **Jesus' return i**n glory.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: MAN'S GREED, GOD'S GRACE
verse: You know the grace of your Lord Jesus  Christ, that though He was rich, yet for  your sakes He became pour, so that you through His poverty might become rich.  (2 Corinthians 8:9).
reflection:
The Bible has much to say about greed as being morally wrong. In the first Commandment, God declares:” You
shall have no other gods before me” (Deuteronomy 5:7). He tells us to fear, love and trust in Him above all things. It is a trans gression of God’s Law to be greedy, to make an idol of wealth of any kind. How do we overcome greed? We need to look to Jesus Christ. He the Son of God gave up everything when He Became incarnate and was born into poverty. He came to atone for all our sins, greed included, and to bring us the incomparable riches of
heaven. His poverty resulted in great spiritual wealth for us: peace with God, the full and free forgiveness of sins as His children and heirs of eternal life. The temp orary things of this world lose their appeal; greed vanishes, for we have the riches of Christ’s grace. Let us thank Jesus for His grace in sacrificing everything, even His very life, for our eternal welfare.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to overcome greed by fixing our eyes on Jesus, who sacrificed everything for our eternal welfare. May we find contentment in the incomparable riches of Your grace and forgiveness, rather than in the temporary things of this world. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1770d626513de17d
subject   : Subject: MAN'S GREED, GOD'S GRACE (1-17-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 16 Jan 2021 16:48:08 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*You know the grace of your Lord Jesus *

*Christ, that though **He was rich, yet for *

*your sakes He became pour, so that **you through His poverty might become
rich. *

(*2 Cor. 8:9).*

*Today’s Reflection:*

The Bible has much to say about greed

as being morally wrong. In the first Commandment, God declares:” You

shall have no other gods before me”

(Deut. 5:7). He tells us to fear, love and

trust in Him above all things. It is a trans-

gression of God’s Law to be greedy, to

make an idol of wealth of any kind. How

do we overcome greed? We need to look

to Jesus Christ. He the Son of God gave

up everything when He Became incarnate

and was born into poverty. He came to

atone for all our sins, greed included, and

to bring us the incomparable riches of

heaven. His poverty resulted in great

spiritual wealth for us: peace with God,

the full and free forgiveness of sins as His children and heirs of eternal
life. The temp-

orary things of this world lose their appeal; greed vanishes, for we have
the riches of Christ’s grace. *Let us **thank Jesus **for His grace in
sacrificing everything, **even His *

*very** life, for our eternal welfare.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: A LIE THAT WOULDN'T FLY
verse: The chief priests . . . gave the soldiers a  large sum of money, telling them, “You are  to say, ‘His disciples came during the night and stole Him away while we were asleep.” (Matthew 28:12-13)
reflection:
The government had taken extra measures to seal the tomb Jesus had been placed in. A government seal had been placed on the entrance, and guards were stationed at the tomb. But these precautions backfired. They were in and of themselves, proof that
the circulated story of the theft of Jesus’ body was a lie.
Now the soldiers had said the body had been stolen by the disciples while they slept, if they were asleep how did they know it was the disciples. Further, when we consider how frightened the disciples were, we would have to believe they were the least likely candidates for grave rob bery.
The truth is simply this: “Christ has indeed been raised from the dead” (I Corinthians 15:20) AND, He was delivered over to death for our sins and was raised to life for our justification.” (Romans 4:25) THE TRUTH PREVAILS.
prayer: Almighty God, we stand in awe of Your power to overcome even death itself, and we thank You for the undeniable truth of Christ's resurrection. May this truth strengthen our faith and embolden us to live as witnesses to Your victory over sin and death. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 177123edb4134641
subject   : Subject: A LIE THAT WOULDN'T FLY (1-18-21)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 17 Jan 2021 15:27:25 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*The chief priests . . . gave the soldiers a *

*large sum of money, telling them, “You are*

* to say, ‘His disciples came during the night and stole Him away while we
were asleep.” *(Mt. 28:12-13)

*Today’s Reflection:*

The government had taken extra measures

to seal the tomb Jesus had been placed in.

A government seal had been placed on the entrance, and guards were
stationed at the tomb. But these precautions back-fired.

They were in and of themselves, proof that

the circulated story of the theft of Jesus’

body was a lie.

Now the soldiers had said the body had been stolen by the disciples
while they

slept, if they were asleep how did they

know it was the disciples. Further, when

we consider how frightened the disciples

were, we would have to believe they were

the least likely candidates for grave rob-

bery.

The truth is simply this: “Christ has indeed been raised from the
dead” (I Cor. 15:20) *AND, * He was delivered over to

death for our sins and was raised to life

for our justification.” (Ro. 4:25)

*THE TRUTH PREVAILS.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: GOD'S PERSPECTIVE
verse: Be on your guard, stand true to what you believe in. Be courageous. Be strong. And everything you do must be done in love. (I Corinthians 16:13, 14)
reflection:
As the Corinthians awaited Paul’s next visit, they were directed to (1)
be on their guard against spiritual dangers, (2) stand firm in the faith (3) be courageous, (4) be strong and, (5) do everything with kindness
and in love. Today as we wait for the return of Christ, we should follow the same instructions. We need to remember love involves unselfish service to others; to show it gives evidence that you care. Remember to let love be your highest goal.
prayer: Faithful God, help us stand firm in our faith, be courageous and strong, and do everything with kindness and love as we await Christ's return. May we remember that love involves unselfish service to others, and guide us to make love our highest goal in all we do. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verses:*

*Be on your guard, stand true to what you believe in. Be courageous. **Be
strong. And everything you do must be done in love.*

(I Cor. 16:13, 14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

As the Corinthians awaited Paul’s next

visit, they were directed to (1) be on their guard against spiritual
dangers, (2) stand

firm in the faith (3) be courageous, (4) be strong and, (5) do everything
with kindness

and in love. Today as we wait for the return

of Christ, we should follow the same instruc-tions. We need to remember
love involves unselfish service to others; *to show *it gives evidence that
you care. *Remember** to let *

*love be your highest goal.*

* Pastor Sather*


Let us pray for a peaceful innagration

subject: LETTING THE LORD SETTLE IT
verse: Judge nothing before the appointed time;  wait tell the Lord comes. (I Corinthians 4:5)
reflection: It also wars us. We are to confront those who are sinning (see I Corinthians 5:12, 13), but we must not judge who is a better servant of Christ. When you judge some one, you invariably consider yourself better-and that is arrogant. Somethings we need to gladly leave to the Lord. When He comes again, He will take things in hand and settle them once and for all.
prayer: Let us ask the Savior to grant us wisdom and love to make the right choices when it is time to do so.

*Today’s Verse:*

*Judge nothing before the appointed time; *

*wait tell the Lord comes. *(I Cor. 4:5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It also wars us. We are to confront those

who are sinning (see I Cor. 5:12, 13),

*but *we must not judge who is a better

servant of Christ. When you judge some-

one, you invariably consider yourself

better—and that is arrogant*. Some**things*

*we need to gladly leave to the Lord. *

*When He comes again, He **will take *

*things in hand and settle them once *

*and for all.*

* Pastor Sather*



*Let us ask the Savior to grant us wisdom *

*and love to make the right** choices when *

*it is time to do so.*

subject: JESUS--A MEMBER OF OUR FAMILY
verse: God knew His people in advance, and He chose them to become like His Son, so  that His Son would be the first born, with many brothers and sisters. (Hebrews 8:29)
reflection: God’s ultimate goal for us is to make us like Christ (I John 3:2). As we become more and more like him, we discover ourselves, the person we were created to be. How can we become like Christ? By reading and heading the Word-By studying His His life on earth through the Gospels, By spending time in prayer By being filled with the Spirit, and By doing His work in the world. Remember He promises to guide and protect us until we one day stand in His presence.
prayer: Let us pray that on that day we will be found faithful!
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*God knew His people in advance, and He chose them to become **like His
Son, so *

*that His Son would be the first born, with many **brothers and sisters. *(Heb.
8:29)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God’s ultimate goal for us is to make us

like Christ (I Jn. 3:2). As we become

more and more like him, we discover ourselves, the person we were created

to be. How can we become like Christ?

*By* reading and heading the Word—*By *studying His His life on earth
through

the Gospels, *By *spending time in prayer

*By* being filled with the Spirit, and *By *

doing His work in the world.

*Remember He promises to guide *

*and protect **us until we one day *

*stand in His presence.*

* Pastor Sather*

*Let us pray that on that day we will be *

*found faithful!*

subject: OUR TRUE HOPE
verse: The People who walk in darkness will see a great light—a light that will shine on all who live in the land where death casts its shadow.  (Isaiah 9:2)
reflection:
Here Isaiah refers to Jesus as Great Light the apostle John also referred to Jesus as the “Light” (JohnI:9) Jesus referred to Him self as the “Light of the world” (John 8:12. When I read the fact that this was considered as a time of ‘great darkness, on the 6th I thought we were heading into a similar time, the fact of the matter is we live in such a time. That ‘darkness” is sin. Then I remembered
God’s promise that He would send a light who would shine on everyone living in the shadow of death. He would be both
“Wonderful Counselor” and “Mighty God.” This message of hope was fulfilled in the birth of Christ and the establishment of His eternal Kingdom. He came to deliver (all) people from their slavery to sin, the darkness we live in today.
prayer: Lord Jesus, Light of the world, shine Your truth and love into the darkness of our lives and guide us along Your path of righteousness. Help us to embrace Your eternal Kingdom and find freedom from the shadows of sin that surround us. (AI)

Here Isaiah refers to Jesus as Great Light—

the apostle John also referred to Jesus as

the “Light” (Jn. I:9) Jesus referred to Him-

self as the “*Light of the world” *(Jn 8:12.

When I read the fact that this was considered as a time of ‘great darkness,
on the 6th I thought we were heading into a similar time, the fact of the
matter is we live in such a time. That ‘darkness” is sin. Then I remembered

God’s promise that He would send a light

who would shine on everyone living in the shadow of death. He would be both

“Wonderful Counselor” and “Mighty God.” This message of hope was fulfilled
in the

birth of Christ and the establishment of His

eternal Kingdom. *He came to deliver (all) people from **their slavery to
sin, the darkness we live in today.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: SURRENDER THE OLD TO RECEIVE THE NEW
verse:
As he (Saul) was nearing Damascus on his mission, a brilliant light from heaven suddenly beamed down on him.
He fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him,  “Saul, Saul! Why are you persecuting me?
(Acts 9:3, 4)
reflection:
Paul refers to his experience as the start of his new life in Christ (1 Corinthians 9:1; 15:18; Galatians 1:15, 16). At the center of this wonder ful experience was Jesus Christ. Paul did not see a vision he saw the risen Christ Himself (9:17). Paul acknowledged Jesus as Lord, confessed his own sin, surrendered his life to Christ, and resolved to obey Him. True conversion comes from a personal encounter with Jesus Christ and leads to a new life in
a relationship with Him.
prayer: Ask the Holy Spirit to keep you in the faith so the Savior Jesus Christ may be glorified in and through you
original_content:

*denly beamed down on **him. He fell to the ground and heard a voice
saying **to him, *

*“Saul, Saul! Why are you persecuting me?*

(Acts 9:3, 4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Paul refers to his experience as the start of

his new life in Christ (1 Cor. 9:1; 15:18;

Gal. 1:15, 16). At the center of this wonder-

ful experience was Jesus Christ. Paul did not

see a vision he saw the risen Christ Himself

(9:17). Paul acknowledged Jesus as Lord, confessed his own sin, surrendered
his life

to Christ, and resolved to obey Him. True conversion comes from a personal
encounter

with Jesus Christ and leads to a new life in

a relationship with Him.

* Pastor Sather*

*Ask the Holy Spirit to keep you in the faith so the **Savior Jesus Christ
may be glorified in and **through you *

subject: RECONCILIATION WITH GOD COME FIRST
verse: We are Christ’s ambassadors, and God is using us to speak to you. We urge you, as though Christ Himself were here pleading  with you, “Be reconciled to God.” (2 Corinthians 5:2)
reflection:
God’s reconciliation of sinners is the top most truth of the Gospel. Reconciliation with God proceeds-not follows-reconciliation to one another in the
community.
An ambassador is an official representative of one country to another. As believers, we are Christ’s ambassadors, sent with His message of reconciliation to the world. An ambassador of reconciliation has an important responsibility.
We dare not take this responsibility lightly. How well are you fulfilling your commission of Christ’s ambassador?
prayer: Ask His help for affecting greater reconciliation among people.
original_content:
message_id: 177317d7286be13b
subject   : Subject: RECONCILIATION WITH GOD COME FIRST (1-24-21)

date      : Sat, 23 Jan 2021 17:04:01 -0600
===================================================================

===================================================================
*Today’ Verse:*

*We are Christ’s ambassadors, and God is using **us to speak to you. We
urge you, as though Christ **Himself were here pleading *

*with you, “Be recon**ciled to God.”*

(2 Cor. 5:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God’s reconciliation of sinners is the top-

most truth of the Gospel. Reconciliation

with God proceeds—not follows—reconciliation to one another in the

community. An ambassador is an official representtative of one country to
another.

As believers, we are Christ’s ambassadors, sent with His message of
reconciliation to

the world. An ambassador of reconciliation has an important responsibility.
We dare not

take this responsibility lightly. *How well *

*are you fulfilling your commission of Christ’s **ambassador?*

* Pastor Sather*

*Ask His help for affecting greater recon-*

*cil**iation **among people.*

subject: JESUS THE GO-BETWEEN
verse: For Christ Himself has made peace be- tween us Jews and you Gentiles by making  us all one people. He has broken down the wall of hostility that used to separate us.  (Ephesians 2:14)
reflection: By faith in the redeeming work of Christ Jesus we, are at peace with God, who is our heavenly Father and we are His sons and daughters. As God children, we are brothers and sisters to one another and strive to live at peace. The Psalmist declares, “How good and pleasant it is when brothers live together in unity!” (Psalm 133:1). When-ever we cross a bridge, we can be remind ed that through our Spiritual bridge, we are one with God and with one another.
prayer: Thank the Lord Jesus for enabling you to be at peace with God for you can now pray to Him boldly and confidently in Jesus’ name.
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*For Christ Himself has made peace be-*

*tween us Jews and **you Gentiles **by making *

*us all one people. He has broken **down the wall of hostility** that used
to separate us. *

(Eph. 2:14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

By faith in the redeeming work of Christ

Jesus we, are at peace with God, who is

our heavenly Father and we are His sons

and daughters. As God children, we are brothers and sisters to one another
and strive to live at peace. The Psalmist declares, “How good and pleasant
it is when brothers

live together in unity!” (Ps. 133:1). *When-ever we **cross **a bridge, we
can be remind-*

*ed that through our **Spiritual bridge, we*

*are one with God and with one **another. *

* Pastor Sather*

*Thank the Lord Jesus for enabling you to be *

*at peace **with God for you** can now pray to Him boldly and **confidently
in Jesus’ name.*

subject: POSSESSING ALL--YET POOR
verse: Your attitude should be the same that Christ Jesus had. Though He was God, He did not demand and cling to His rights as God.  (Philippians 2:5, 6)
reflection: Jesus Christ was humble, willing to give up His rights in order to obey God and serve people. Like Christ, we should have a servant’s attitude, serving out of love for God and for others, not out of guilt and fear. Remember you can choose your attitude. You can approach life expecting to be served, or you can look for opportune ities to serve others. See Mark 10:45 for more on Christ’s attitude of servant hood.
prayer: Give thanks to God for His unspeakable grace in sending His Son into the World as the all-sufficient Savior.

subject: THE TWO TREES
verse: Christ has rescued us from the curse pronounced by the law. When He was  hung on the cross, He took upon Him- self the curse of our wrong doing. For  it is written in the Scriptures,“Cursed  is everyone who is hung on a tree.”  (Galatians 3:13)
reflection:
I came across this saying about Satan, “That he by a tree once overcame, might likewise by a tree be overcome.” That tree
was the cross on which Jesus defeated the devil. In overcoming Satan, God’s Son overcame sin and death. He bore the curse of sin in our place. Through faith In Him as our Savior we are redeemed and given eternal life.
“Without faith it is impossible to please God.” (Hebrews 11:6)
prayer: Gracious God, we thank You for sending Your Son to overcome sin and death through His sacrifice on the cross. May our faith in Jesus as our Savior grow stronger each day, drawing us closer to You and the eternal life You promise. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17741464ace20b0e
subject   : Subject: THE TWO TREES (1-27-21)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Christ has rescued us from the curse*

*pronounced **by the law.** When He was *

*hung on the cross, He took upon Him-*

*self the** curse of our wrong doing. For *

*it is written in the Scriptures,**“Cursed *

*is everyone who is hung on a tree.” *

(Gal 3:13)



*Today’s Reflection:*

I came across this saying about Satan,

“That he by a tree once overcame, might likewise by a tree be overcome.”
That tree

was the cross on which Jesus defeated the devil. In overcoming Satan, God’s
Son overcame sin and death. He bore the curse

of sin in our place. Through faith In Him

as our Savior we are redeemed and given eternal life. “*Without **faith it
is impossible *

*to please God.” *(Heb. 11:6)

* Pastor Sather*

subject: CHRIST'S PEACE: PERFECT, PERMANENT
verse: He will be called . . . Prince of Peace.  (Isaiah 9:6)
reflection:
How can we be sure of the permanence of Christ’s peace? The prophet continued with this proof: “For to us a Child is born, to us a Son is given.” (Isaiah 9:6). This Child made a perfect and permanent peace with God through the reconciation He effected as the Lamb of God sacrificed for our sins.
Now the church’s spokesmen can comfort God’s people by proclaiming to them that their warfare is accomplished, their iniquity is pardoned. As God in Christ forgives us, so we are to forgive others. We do more than bury the hatch with the handle sticking out. We forgive really and truly-from the heart. We are to live in peace with all people.
prayer: Let us thank the Savior, the price of peace, for carrying out His ministry of reconciliation and for granting us peace.
original_content:
message_id: 177461e6df918afe
subject   : Subject: CHRIST'S PEACE: PERFECT, PERMANENT (1-28-21)

date      : Wed, 27 Jan 2021 17:12:15 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*He will be called . . . Prince of Peace. *

(Isa. 9:6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

How can we be sure of the permanence

of Christ’s peace? The prophet continued

with this proof: “For to us a Child is born,

to us a Son is given.” (Isa. 9:6). This Child made a perfect and permanent
peace with

God through the reconciation He effected as

the Lamb of God sacrificed for our sins.

Now the church’s spokesmen can comfort God’s people by proclaiming to them
that

their warfare is accomplished, their iniquity

is pardoned. As God in Christ forgives us,

so we are to forgive others. *We do more *

*than bury the hatch with* *the** handle sticking out. We forgive really
and truly—from **the heart. We are to live in peace *

*with all people.*

* Pastor Sather*



*Let us thank the Savior, the price of peace, for carrying out **His
ministry of reconcil-iation and for granting us peace.*

subject: A PRICE TO PAY
verse: And since we are His children, we will share His treasures—for everything God gives to  His Son, Christ, is ours, too. But if we are  to share His glory, we must also share His suffering. (Romans 8:17)
reflection: There is a price to pay for being identified with Jesus. Along with the great treasures, Paul mentions the sufferings that Christians must face. What kind of sufferings are we to endure? For first century believers, there was economic and social persecution, and some even faced death. We, too, must pay a price for following Jesus. In many parts of the world, Christians face pressures just a sever as those faced by Christ’s first followers. Even in countries where Christianity is tolerated or encouraged, Christians must not become complacent. To live as Jesus did-serving others, giving up one’s right, resisting pressures to conform to the world-always exacts a price. Nothing we suffer, however, can compare-to the great price that Jesus paid to save us.
prayer: During times of difficulty ask the Holy Spirit to assure you, on the basis of God's promises in His Word, that you belong to Christ's family.
original_content:
message_id: 1774b5187199f286

Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*And since we are His children, we will share His treasures—for everything
God gives to *

*His Son, Christ, is ours, too. But if we are *

*to share His** glory, we must also share His suffering. *(Ro. 8:17)



*Today’s Reflection: *

There is a price to pay for being identified with Jesus. Along with the
great treasures, Paul mentions the sufferings that Christians must face. What
kind of sufferings are we to endure? For first century believers, there was
economic and social persecution, and some even faced death. We, too, must
pay a price

for following Jesus. In many parts of the world, Christians face pressures
just a sever

as those faced by Christ’s first followers.

Even in countries where Christianity is tolerated or encouraged, Christians
must

not become complacent. To live as Jesus

did—serving others, giving up one’s right, resisting pressures to conform
to the world—always exacts a price. *Nothing we suffer, however, can
comp**are—to
the great price that Jesus paid to save **us. *

* Pastor Sather*

*During times of difficulty ask the Holy Spirit to*

*assure you, on the basis of God's promises in*

*His Word, that you belong to Christ's family. *

subject: THE DAY OF HOPE HAS DAWNED
verse: Someone calls to me from Seir, “Watchman, what is left of the night? . . . The watchman replies, “Morning is coming, but also the night.” (Isaiah 21:11-12)
reflection: It is night in many parts of the world; there is dense spiritual darkness-witchcraft, sorcery, Satanism. There are the primitive religions of voodoo, paganism, and occult ism that even in our so-called enlightened times and places are practiced. But Christ ians have ample reason to thank God for the coming of Jesus Christ the light of the world. This is what God did through His Son: “He has rescued us from the dominion of dark ness and brought us into the kingdom of the Son He loves, in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins” (Colossians 1:13-14). What glorious Good News to shine throughout the world!
prayer: Holy God, we thank You for sending Jesus Christ as the light of the world, rescuing us from darkness and bringing us into Your kingdom of love and forgiveness. Shine Your glorious Good News throughout the world, dispelling spiritual darkness and drawing all people to Your redeeming grace. (AI)

*Today’s Verses:*

*Someone calls to me from Seir, “Watchman, what is left of the **night? . .
. The watchman replies, “Morning is coming, but **also the night.” *(Isa
21:11-12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It is night in many parts of the world; there

is dense spiritual darkness—witchcraft, sorcery, Satanism. There are the
primative religions of voodoo, paganism, and occult-

ism that even in our so-called enlightened times and places are practiced. But
Christ-

ians have ample reason to thank God for the coming of Jesus Christ the
light of the world. This is what God did through His Son: “He has rescued
us from the dominion of dark-

ness and brought us into the kingdom of the Son He loves, in whom we have
redemption, the forgiveness of sins” (Col. 1:13-14). *What glorious Good
News to shine through**out *

*the world!*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: IN PARTNERSHIP WITH GOD
verse: As God’s fellow workers we urge you not to receive God’s grace in vain . . . I tell you, now is the time of God’s favor, now is the day of salvation. (2 Corinthians 6:1-2)
reflection: As far as our salvation is concerned, Christ has completed it. We can-add-nothing. We are fully redeemed by Jesus’ blood shed on the cross. BUT let us not forget there is work for us to do, not to earn salvation but to serve the Lord in whatever situation He places us . . . Our response is to do good works for the glory of God, for the good of our neighbor, and for the joy of knowing that we fulfill a purpose in life. It is always time to spread the glad tidings of salvation in Christ, The apostles faithfully did what Christ commanded they preached His Gospel to the world. We too can praise our Lord by what we say and do. We confess our faith in Him when we share what we have with others. We give our witness by our actions and our words, and by what we leave undone: the works of a sinful world.
prayer: Let us give thanks to Christ for making us a partner in the spreading of the Gospel.

*Today’s Verses:*

*As God’s fellow workers we urge you not to receive God’s grace in vain . .
. I tell you, now is the time of God’s favor, now is the day of salvation.*
(2 Cor. 6:1-2)


*Today’s Reflection:*

As far as our salvation is concerned, Christ

has completed it. *We— **can—add—nothing.* We are fully redeemed by Jesus’
blood shed on the cross. BUT let *us not* forget there is work for us to
do, *not* to earn salvation *but*

to serve the Lord in whatever situation He places us *. . . *Our response
is to do good

works for the glory of God, for the good of

our neighbor, and for the joy of knowing that we fulfill a purpose in life.
It is always time

to spread the glad tidings of salvation in Christ, The apostles faithfully
did what Christ commanded*—*they preached His Gospel to

the world. We too can praise our Lord by what we say and do. We confess our
faith in Him when we share what we have with others. We give our witness by
our actions and our words, and by what we leave undone: the works of a
sinful world.

*Pastor Sather*


*Let us give thanks to Christ for making us *

*a partner in the spreading **of the Gospel.*

subject: GOD'S WITNESS OF HIMSELF
verse: Since the creation of the world His invisible attributes are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even His eternal power and Godhead, so they (mankind) is without excuse. (Romans 1:20)
reflection: God reveals His divine nature and personal qualities through creation, even though creation’s testimony has been distorted by the Fall. Adam’s sin resulted in a divine curse upon the whole natural order (Genesis 3: 17-19); thorns and thistles were an immed ate result, and natural disasters have been common from Adam’s day to ours. In (Romans 8:19-21)Paul says that nature itself is eagerly waiting its own redemption from the effects of sin (see Revelation 22;3).
prayer: Let us give thanks to God for having revealed Himself as the Father of Jesus Christ and our Father.

date      : Sun, 31 Jan 2021 16:47:37 -0600

Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Since the creation of the world His invisible attributes are clearly
seen,** being
understood by the things that are made, even His eternal power** and
Godhead, so they (mankind) is without excuse. *(Ro. 1:20)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God reveals His divine nature and personal qualities through creation,
*even* though creation’s testimony has been distorted by

the Fall. Adam’s sin resulted in a divine

curse upon the whole natural order (Gen.3:

17-19); thorns and thistles were an immed-

ate result, and natural disasters have been common from Adam’s day to ours.
In (Ro. 8:19-21)Paul says that nature itself is eagerly waiting its own
redemption from the effects

of sin (see Rev. 22;3).

*Pastor Sather*

*Let us give thanks to God for having revealed Himself as the** Father of
Jesus Christ and our Father.*

subject: CHRISTIANS AS STEWARDS
verse: He who has been stealing must steal no longer but must work, doing something useful with his own hands, that he may have  something to share with those in need. (Ephesians 4:28)
reflection:
The first Christians, we are told, “had everything in common” (Acts 2:44). Many sold their possessions and put their money
into a common fund. God had not comm anded such an arrangement, in fact, when He commanded, “You shall not steal”
Exodus 20:15), He presupposed the existence of private property. What God does require is that His people be faithful stewards of all that He gives them. All we have has been entrusted to us for furthering God’s King dom. In this respect, the Jerusalem Christ ians were to set a good example, not that we should relinquish our goods and enter into a communal lifestyle, but that we use our proceeds to God’s glory and for the good of people, including ourselves. It is interesting to note that Paul did not advocate communism.
prayer: We need to ask the Lord Jesus to strengthen us in the conviction that all we are and have are at His disposal.

*Subject: CHRISTIANS AS STEWARDS *(2-2-21)



*Today’s Verse:*

*He who has been stealing must steal no long-er but must work, **doing
something useful*

* with his own hands, that he may have*

*something** to share with those in need.*

(Eph. 4:28)


*Today’s Reflection:*

The first Christians, we are told, “had everything in common” (Acts 2:44).
Many sold their possessions and put their money

into a common fund. God had not comm-

anded such an arrangement, in fact, when

He commanded, “You shall not steal”

Ex. 20:15), He presupposed the existence

of private property. What God does require

is that His people be faithful stewards of all

that He gives them. All we have has been entrusted to us for furthering
God’s King-

dom. In this respect, the Jerusalem Christ-

ians were to set a good example, not that we should relinquish our goods
and enter into a communal lifestyle, but that we use our proceeds to God’s
glory and for the good of people, including ourselves. *It is interesting
to note that Paul **did not* *advocate communism.*

* Pastor Sather*

*We need to ask the Lord Jesus to strengthen us in the **conviction that
all we are and have** are at His disposal. *
